title: [0 YoE, Student, Machine Learning Intern, United States]
text:
Alex Rivera
(555) 013-4827 | alex.rivera@northfield.edu | linkedin.com/in/alexrivera-ml/ | github.com/alexrivera | alexrivera.dev

EDUCATION
Northfield University                                                     Madison, WI
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, GPA 3.96/4.0                        2023 – 2027
Relevant Courses
Linear Algebra, Multivariable Calculus, Probability in Computing, Computer Systems, Java

EXPERIENCE
Deputy Software Lead at Rover Club                                         Aug 2024 – Present
Northfield University                                                     Madison, WI
• Led a 14-person team for the development of an autonomous rover to compete in the University Rover Challenge
• Fine-tuned Mask R-CNN machine learning model for high-performance object detection of custom items to
  maneuver with the rover arm
• Researched the Soft Actor-Critic reinforcement learning algorithm for reliable autonomous control of rover arm
• Developed an autonomous navigation system using A* on GPS data and a SLAM cost map generated using a Zed
  Stereo Camera and LIDAR system
• Transitioned the team to simulation-driven design using ROS Gazebo to increase development agility and increase
  team involvement

Software Lead at Highschool Robotics                                       Sep 2022 – May 2023
Cupertino STEM High School                                                 Cupertino, CA
• Led a 6-person team responsible for the development of the control system for the swerve drivetrain
• Swerve drivetrain enabled independent control of direction and velocity, granting greater maneuverability
• Won the Impact Award and competed in the finals of the San Francisco Regional competition
• Qualified for and competed in the First World Championship through improved mobility and design

PROJECTS
Research on Forest Fire Detection | Python, Jax/Flax, IsaacSim              Aug 2022 – May 2023
• Led a team to conduct research for predicting the probability of a forest fire occurring using drone footage
• Used a DJI Mini 2 to collect image data of forests and performed SFM pose estimation to collect flight trajectories
• Used images and positional data to train a Neural Radiance Field of the Forest
• Created a novel visual transformer neural network architecture, incorporating Neural Radiance Fields in
  cross-attention as a knowledge base to query forest properties, such as likelihood of a forest fire
• Won Second Place at the Synopsys Science Fair out of over a thousand competitors

Adversarial Self-Driving | Python, PyTorch, Carla                           June 2021 – Aug 2022
• Conducted research to improve the performance and reliability of self-driving cars
• Developed an algorithm using generative adversarial networks to increase training efficiency for Self-Driving cars
• Achieved a 14 % increase in accuracy, from 83 % to 97 %, over a baseline Resnet model in a small-scale model
  environment
• Wrote a research paper and presented it at the Junior Science and Humanities Symposium
• Published the research paper in the Journal of Student Research and arXiv
• Won the IBM Best Project Award at the Synopsys Science Fair

TECHNICAL SKILLS, INTERESTS & AWARDS
Languages: Python, C/C++, Java, C#, JavaScript, HTML/CSS
Frameworks/Libraries: PyTorch, Jax/Flax, Keras, NumPy, Django, Flask, FastAPI, React, Node.js
Interests: Using machine learning to solve real-world problems, Automation, Creating efficient hardware-aware
algorithms, Creating a real life JARVIS
Awards: Dean’s List Award at University, Published Research Paper in the Journal of Student Research, USA
Computing Olympiad Gold Division, AP Scholar with Distinction Award
